title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

00:45 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki

08:28 <sburjan`> has quit  
08:31 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <sdumitriu> has quit

09:52 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <evalica> has quit  
11:04 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:05 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:23 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <vmassol> mflorea: ETA for the 3.0M3 release?  
11:33 <+mflorea> I'm finishing right now with the WYSIWYG tests but I see there are plenty of selenium tests from other modules that fail  
11:33 <+mflorea> @vmassol  
11:34 <vmassol> sergiu still hasn't comitted user status either :(  
11:34 <jstoldt> tmortagne: i pointed to the specific subprojects now. dunno if that is sufficient for building XE if sara sara wanted to...  
11:35 <vmassol> also mflorea if we don't introduce xwiki commons it's going to be hard for you to do the release (possible but painful)  
11:36 <vmassol> I'm working on it but I don't have much time (in mgmt meeting right now) so it's slow  
11:36 <@cjdelisle> I have trash attachments, it's buggy to the point of non-functional but everything is there.  
11:36 <vmassol> IMO we need 2-3 more days for xwiki commons  
11:36 <vmassol> seems we're lagging on all fronts…. :(  
11:36 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: yea well not sure, http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/ is definitely too big but it should still work on tortoise (and http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/SourceRepository explain that)  
11:37 <@cjdelisle> well... everything except unit tests but unit tests against xwiki-core take about 2 per day for me.  
11:37 <jstoldt> yep, that's why i pointed to the /trunks in case of platform... just like suggested  
11:37 <jstoldt> i used to check out with the https links i posted like two or three weeks ago and it worked just fine  
11:37 <+mflorea> vmassol: are there selenium tests failing because of this? I'm thinking we should first make the test pass and then assert the status of xwiki-commons  
11:37 <vmassol> we need an ETA from sergiu for user status  
11:38 <vmassol> mflorea: yes tests need to be fixed  
11:38 <+tmortagne> lets see, i will just add a comment saying that it's generally beter to ask question on the mailing list to get quick answers  
11:38 <jstoldt> oki doki  
11:39 <@cjdelisle> I can commit this now and it will sit quietly without interrupting anything until I figure out a couple bugs or I can keep working on them a little longer. Any thoughts?  
11:40 <+mflorea> vmassol: I'll commit my WYSIWYG editor changes and then I'll take a look of the remaining functional tests. let's talk after lunch, maybe sergiu will login by then  
11:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:56 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:06 <jvdrean> has quit  
12:07 <vmassol> how we are graded against other projects: https://programeter.com/projectgrader/xwiki-core  
12:08 <vmassol> but it doesn't mean much  
12:09 <vmassol> since I guess it's average on the whole project's life  
12:14 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
12:21 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:26 <tmortagne> has quit  
12:27 <tuxlover> has joined #xwiki  
12:28 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:29 <tuxlover> i need some help with my xwiki setup i cannot figure out why i cannot login  
12:29 <tuxlover> i have opensuse 11.3 tomcat6 and mysql running  
12:31 <@cjdelisle> What do you see? You can navigate fine as guest but you click login and type in Admin passwd: admin and you click login and then what?  
12:31 <@cjdelisle> (Is that what happens?)  
12:32 <tuxlover> i get Permissions denied  
12:32 <tuxlover> also i cannot add the xar file  
12:33 <@cjdelisle> ahh. Have you tried clicking administration in the upper left corner?  
12:34 <@cjdelisle> you can't login until you have imported the .xar file (chicken and the egg problem)  
12:35 <@cjdelisle> echo 'make first installation easier' >> todo  
12:38 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
12:56 <tuxlover> cjdelisle: its quite simple to setup so far. i cklick on the import button than i select the xar file. but when i click upload, nothing happens  
12:56 <tuxlover> is there a way to install the archive manualy under /srv/tomcat6/webapps/xwiki somehow?  
12:58 <@cjdelisle> No that doesn't work.  
13:00 <tuxlover> hmm what could possibly went wrong here  
13:01 <@cjdelisle> do you see anything in the tomcat log?  
13:01 <@cjdelisle> perhaps mysql max packet errors?  
13:09 <tuxlover> can you log at the catalina.log  
13:10 <tuxlover> http://pastebin.com/KxYRkgNC  
13:12 <abusenius> has quit  
13:14 <@cjdelisle> hmm looks like it's being shut down just as soon as it starts.  
13:15 <tuxlover> what is shutting down? what do you mean  
13:15 <@cjdelisle> [com.mysql.jdbc.Driver] but failed to unregister it when the web application was stopped  
13:16 <@cjdelisle> line 26. I confes I am not familiar with those messages but they seem to indicate it is shutting down.  
13:17 <tuxlover> i see the wiki page and the sql daemon is alos running  
13:18 <tuxlover> Pollux:/var/log/tomcat6 # service mysql status  
13:18 <tuxlover> Checking for service MySQL:                                                                                                                       running  
13:19 <@cjdelisle> I was going to suggest looking to see if there are any mysql queries happening. It autogenerates a schema even before you import the .xar  
13:19 <@cjdelisle> So when you first start it, you should see a flood of sql queries.  
13:20 <tuxlover> start what the wiki or mysql or tomcat6 ?  
13:23 <@cjdelisle> when xwiki starts but ofc tomcat and mysql would have to be running.  
13:26 <tuxlover> ok i cannot find something unusal in the mysql logfile  
13:27 <@cjdelisle> but you do see traffic coming from xwiki when it starts correct?  
13:27 <vmassol> shutting down mac to install 8GB of RAM!  
13:28 <@cjdelisle> :) You'd be surprised how fast it disappears  
13:30 <tuxlover> ok how can i look at mysql connections  
13:30 <tuxlover> in the logfile is just that it did satrt up  
13:31 <@cjdelisle> I think it's safe to assume that you have a connection to the db since you can see the wiki when you strt it up.  
13:31 <vmassol> has quit  
13:33 <tuxlover> ok than what is blocking the upload of the xar file  
13:34 <tuxlover> http://pastebin.com/FhuSVxB5  
13:34 <tuxlover> this is what i have done so far  
13:34 <tuxlover> this is the documentation i have written for my setup  
13:34 <tuxlover> can you see something unusual here?  
13:37 <@cjdelisle> "uncomment the non neeeded database" I assume you meant to say "comment out the unneeded dbs"  
13:37 <@cjdelisle> esp. hsqldb which is uncommented to begin with.  
13:38 <tuxlover> yes thats what i mean  
13:40 <@cjdelisle> Sorry I can't be of much help now. Lacking sleep and trying to squash a bug.  
13:41 <tuxlover> ok  
13:41 <mflorea> has quit  
13:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <tuxlover> is there a logfiel for the xwiki  
13:45 <vmassol> back! (with 8GB now :))  
13:51 <@cjdelisle> Well I gotta call it quits. Still a bug preventing rollback from working right with attachments. I can commit and have broken code in the tree or I can sit on 2000 lines and keep working on it on local. WDYT?  
13:52 <vmassol> if it doesn't break the build nor other xwiki features you can commit if you prefer  
13:52 <@cjdelisle> It's close to working, just a matter of interfaces not lining up between attachments and core.  
13:52 <@cjdelisle> It won't break anything unless someone changes xwiki.cfg.  
13:53 <@cjdelisle> Ok. Committing and sleeping  
13:54 <vmassol> starting to work on cleaning up xwiki-velocity in term of deps (for the upcoming move to xwiki commons)  
13:54 <tuxlover> think is i treid out the jar and here everything works out fine. of course its using a complete other setup  
13:54 <tuxlover> what is this xar file anyway  
13:55 <tuxlover> maybe a package must be installed to handle this file  
14:18 <venkatna> has joined #xwiki  
14:19 <venkatna> has quit  
14:32 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <tuxlover> interesting i am able to import the admin toll 2.0  
14:43 <tuxlover> tool  
14:46 <tuxlover> i going to think the xar package is defect  
15:05 <sdumitriu> has quit  
15:22 <tuxlover> it seems the xar package is too big somehow  
15:22 <tuxlover> maybe i trie posgresql  
15:27 <tuxlover> i got it now. you have to edit /etc/init.d/tomcat6 and add TOMCAT6\_SECURITY=no  
15:29 <abusenius> has quit  
15:31 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <tuxlover> thank you for your patience  
15:32 <tuxlover> i will write a new blogentry for this to describe  
15:32 <vmassol> tuxlover: I think it's already dcoumented  
15:33 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationTomcat  
16:09 <vmassol> fyi going to move back xwiki10 syntax to platform/ (from rendering/)  
16:10 <vmassol> mflorea: IMO we should propose to delay again the 3.0M3 release to next Monday....  
16:12 <+mflorea> vmassol: what's left to do besides fixing the tests and the xwiki-commons thing?  
16:12 <vmassol> user status  
16:12 <vmassol> (from sergiu)  
16:13 <+mflorea> right, and I don't see sergiu online  
16:13 <vmassol> unfortunately yes… we need feedback from him  
16:13 <vmassol> but even re xwiki-commons we need at least 2 more days IMO  
16:13 <vmassol> (and it's already tight)  
16:14 <+mflorea> ok, I'll send the mail  
16:14 <vmassol> thanks  
16:24 <tuxlover> hmm yeah i did'nt read that could've safed me time :)  
16:24 <vmassol> s/fyi going to move back xwiki10 syntax to platform/ (from rendering/)/didn't say anything/  
16:25 <tuxlover> http://geistreicher-papierkorb.blogspot.com/2011/03/setting-up-xwiki-on-opensuse-with-mysql.html  
16:25 <tuxlover> i wrote the one for openssue  
16:26 <vmassol> ah cool  
16:26 <vmassol> we should link it  
16:26 <vmassol> tuxlover: please use XWiki and not Xwiki :)  
16:26 <tuxlover> yeah i will do iot  
16:27 <vmassol> did you read http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationMySQL for mysql?  
16:28 <vmassol> the installation page is at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation  
16:29 <vmassol> we have some tutorials listed on there: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HTutorials  
16:29 <vmassol> you can a link to yours if you want  
16:29 <vmassol> s/can/can add/  
16:29 <vmassol> IMO you should link to http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HTutorials from your tutorial  
16:29 <vmassol> (tuxlover)  
16:30 <tuxlover> Yeah i will to this  
16:33 <tuxlover> better now ?  
16:33 <vmassol> better but I don't see a link to the Installation page  
16:34 <tuxlover> its on the bottom  
16:34 <vmassol> seems useful to me since what you're doing is extracting info from the installation page from xwiki and putting that in a tutorial  
16:34 <vmassol> it's to the download page  
16:34 <vmassol> not the installation page  
16:34 <vmassol> oh you mean the download page links to the installation  
16:34 <vmassol> hmm ok  
16:34 <vmassol> :)  
16:34 <tuxlover> yeah :)  
16:35 <tuxlover> now thats up and running i must say i really like this wiki :)  
16:35 <vmassol> cool  
16:36 <tuxlover> and now that i spend the whole day figuring this out i have to go outside  
16:36 <tuxlover> see you  
16:36 <tuxlover> thanks for your help :)  
16:36 <vmassol> tuxlover: I've added a linkt to your tutorial from http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HTutorials  
16:36 <tuxlover> thanks now i have to take some rest  
16:36 <tuxlover> cu  
16:37 <tuxlover> has left #xwiki  
18:01 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
18:06 <sburjan> has quit  
18:06 <evalica> has quit  
18:10 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
18:25 <evalica> has quit  
18:30 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you have an opinion on VelocityFactory (my last mail on the list) ?  
18:31 <vmassol> (i'm hesitating)  
18:31 <Enygma`> has quit  
18:31 <+tmortagne> vmassol: did not had time to look at it, will try to find some time in 1h (something to finish absolutely right now)  
18:32 <vmassol> ok I have to leave early but if you reply I can then work on it later tonight  
18:32 <vmassol> thanks  
18:44 <+tmortagne> vmassol: where is DefaultVelocityManager located and how it knows that it has to call "webapp" ?  
18:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: just sent another mail  
18:44 <vmassol> it's in -default  
18:45 <vmassol> ah no  
18:45 <vmassol> wait  
18:45 <vmassol> it's in xwiki-core  
18:45 <vmassol> it knows it has to call "webapp" because it's xwiki  
18:45 <vmassol> and xwiki uses a "webapp" environment  
18:45 <+tmortagne> if it's in xwiki-core then it's ok  
18:46 <vmassol> the alternative is WebAppVelocityFactory  
18:46 <+tmortagne> but why not stay with "default" hint and make XWiki overwrite it ?  
18:46 <vmassol> but I think I prefer an additional param  
18:46 <vmassol> we shouldn't bundle anything with overrides  
18:46 <vmassol> becuase otherwise it breaks the mechanism  
18:46 <vmassol> ie not allowing users to provide their own implementations  
18:46 <+tmortagne> what will be in commons finally ?  
18:46 <+tmortagne> from velocity i mean  
18:46 <vmassol> velocity-default at the minimum  
18:47 <vmassol> then if we agree to have container  
18:47 <vmassol> then we can also have velocity-webapp  
18:47 <vmassol> personally I think it should be in there  
18:47 <+tmortagne> what do you have to do to be able to use velocity in commons ?  
18:47 <vmassol> minimal usage is to use -default  
18:48 <vmassol> you create an engine using the veloctiy factory impl  
18:48 <vmassol> and then use the engine  
18:48 <vmassol> got to go  
18:48 <vmassol> bb in a few hours … sorry have to rush, I'm late  
18:48 <+tmortagne> ok  
18:48 <+tmortagne> reading your new mail

21:16 <magpi> Hi! I've a question about wysiwyg plugin  
21:18 <magpi> I try to make a new plugin for wysiwyg editor. But, although I've added the plugin name in macros.vm (wysiwyg.menu parameter), I can't make the menu item to appear in editor...  
21:19 <magpi> Is there anyway to know if jar that contains plugin is loaded or whether any aspect I'm doing worng?
